normalized: a vast forest spread out around seishuu academy.
it was a deep forest nestled in the seishuu mountains, which had once been known as a training ground for yamabushi.
(tl: hermitic followers of shugendou, an ancient religion mixed of shinto, buddhism, taoism and so on.
according to legend, during the sengoku period, when the whole of japan was consumed by war, a certain holy man had received a divine revelation from fudou myouou on this land.
(tl: aka the buddhist wisdom king acala.
in order to spread that teaching, he opened a dojo, which became seishuu temple, and aimed to help living things through all his life.
because of its founder, the holy man's, last request, 「do not honour my name」, his name hadn't been handed down to the present day.
even the location where seishuu temple itself had been was no longer known nowadays, and there seemed to be a trend in recent research to doubt its existence.
even so, the name of “seishuu”, which the holy man was said to have practiced, firmly remained to the present day.
i had heard that students, rather than followers of shugendou, were devoting every day to the practice.
the forest on the outer edge of the academy was being more or less tended to, since it was that kind of place, but if one set foot a little deeper into it, they would get lost in an instant.
this was the sort of school ghost story you often got, but it was said that students who had gone exploring and never came back were wandering inside the forest even now.

name: tatsurou
normalized: （well, around here, i'm trying to get lost on purpose, aren't i?
as i sprinted through the forest at night with shizuru-san, i was keenly aware of the enemy's intention to try to remove intruders.
i had counted a truly obscene number of what looked, at a glance, like the kind of thickets that they had everywhere.
the trees that grew here had shapes that all looked alike, to the point where one might think they were clones, and i was seized by the illusion that we weren't progressing at all.
of course, there wasn't even a rock to act as a landmark, and yet security devices were hidden everywhere.
so rigorously that i doubted they would even put so many on a military base.

name: tatsurou
normalized: （…tch, again?
shizuru-san had suddenly stopped her legs.
i stood still as well.
i wasn't asking 「what is it?
」 every time anymore.
silently using her tree escape arts, shizuru-san sprouted ivy from her right hand, and disarmed a security device, the number of which i had stopped counting long ago.
shizuru-san looked back at me as she retracted her ivy, and said 「i disarmed it」 with her eyes.
i also nodded to that in silence, and

name: shizuru
normalized: …haah.
perhaps because she had understandably gotten fed up, shizuru-san sighed slightly.

name: tatsurou
normalized: no matter how you look at it, there are too many.
i started talking in a small voice.
of course, i was covering the area around us with “wind”, and making sure that our voices couldn't leak outside.
chatting during infiltrations was strictly prohibited, but, seeming to also have become unable to take it anymore, shizuru-san opened her mouth as well.

name: shizuru
normalized: honestly, how many of these things are there?

name: tatsurou
normalized: more of these things isn't necessarily better, though, is it?

name: shizuru
normalized: seriously.
these guys are amateurs.
shizuru-san sighed, criticizing the people from washizu material who had set these.
from our prior investigation, we knew that it wasn't just this hidden defence system, but that armed guards also patrolled every few hours.
even if they only saw the footprints that we must have left, that would be too many unnatural things for this forest, which few people supposedly came to.

name: tatsurou
normalized: since it's this stringent, it seems like there's something there, even if the reader we want isn't.

name: shizuru
normalized: it's like declaring 『we're hiding something』, isn't it?
shizuru-san smiled, as if scoffing at the enemy.

name: tatsurou
normalized: then, shall we go find it?

name: shizuru
normalized: yeah, make sure not to get careless, okay?

name: tatsurou
normalized: right.
we nodded at one another, and began proceeding through the dark, security-ridden forest once again.
almost an hour later.
the place had suddenly opened up.
we had avoided the security devices and groups of guards, and the forest had finally ended.
the forest suddenly cut off and disappeared, and a beautifully- maintained lawn spread out before my eyes.
in the middle of it was a flat modern building.
it was the washizu material co.
research facility.
two aboveground floors, like a common low-rise apartment complex.
it was surprisingly small for a research facility, but, of course, that was just the part we could see.
as was usually the case, the main section was entirely underground.
the research facility, which was comparable to an enormous department store, was buried beneath that small building.
it was on a level where, if shizuru-san hadn't acquired the plans, we would have to keep coming back to investigate for several months.

name: shizuru
normalized: well, shall we proceed cautiously?
shizuru-san said, hiding in a break in the forest.
our target was the room that we inferred to be washizu shigeru's other office.
the location was known.
all that remained was to go there, making sure not to get found out.

name: shizuru
normalized: i'll leave it to you, tatsurou-kun♪
shizuru-san looked back at me and lightly winked.
it was sudden, so i was just a little startled.
this was a troublesome person.

name: tatsurou
normalized: un, understood.
well, then…
i understood what 「i'll leave it to you」 meant.
shizuru-san was prompting me to scout out the location, which had opened up so unnaturally, with my wind escape arts.
i focused my mind, and created several small whirlwinds.
i fired them rhythmically in the direction of the research facility.
when the whirlwinds i had released came into contact with large organisms, they turned into sound waves that only i could hear, and bounced back.
along with an exact image of the shape of the organism they touched.
it was like a submarine's sonar, as it were.

name: tatsurou
normalized: field mouse… wild bird… a snake perhaps?
there are no people.
i reported to shizuru-san, while individually checking the images of the living things, which spread out like ripples inside my head.

name: shizuru
normalized: if that's the case, then all that's left is the security system.
i have the positions of the surveillance cameras in my head.

name: tatsurou
normalized: of course.
i'll leave the security to you.

name: shizuru
normalized: roger.
please take care of the wind guard.

name: tatsurou
normalized: understood.
i enveloped shizuru-san and myself in wind, for the sake of hiding the sound of our footsteps and deceiving the usual kinds of security systems.
fuwah.

name: shizuru
normalized: anh!
shizuru-san shrank her head back, as if she had been tickled by my wind.

name: shizuru
normalized: that was like i'd been caressed all of a sudden.

name: tatsurou
normalized: you prompted that, shizuru-san.

name: shizuru
normalized: fufu, sorry.
shizuru-san stuck out her tongue, very mischievously.
why was she playing with me, even at a time like this?
did i look like i was that nervous?

name: shizuru
normalized: well, let's go!

name: tatsurou
normalized: yes.
shizuru-san suddenly made a serious face.
her glasses gleamed.
hmm.
she was more attractive this way.
after that, our movements were quick.
we had swiftly approached the facility like a snake sneaking up on its prey.
skillfully so, of course, when it came to the surveillance cameras' blind spots.
even in the unlikely event that we showed up, we probably just looked like a momentary shadow.
it was movement that fast.
we hadn't been dispatched as “grass” just for show.
we were both taimanin who excelled at covert activities.
we had reached the building in the blink of an eye.
of course, the doors were locked, but even so――
kachiri.
without even time to take a breath, shizuru-san unlocked them with her vines.
we nodded in silence, and slipped into the research facility through the opened doors.
the aboveground parts were ordinary office-type floors, so almost no security devices had been set.
they had no purpose in places like that.
we proceeded to the underground floors, which, based on the blueprints from our prior intelligence, were the core of the research facility.
when we entered the underground area, the look of the interior completely changed.
a long passageway continued indefinitely.
its width was about 3 metres, and its height up to the ceiling was about the same.
the sides of the passage were packed with energy supply pipes, various kinds of data cables, and suspicious flashing instruments.
they looked like blood vessels.
if we assumed that, then was this the inside of a machine's stomach?
the passageway itself formed an arc, and i couldn't identify its end point.
it was an extremely dangerous design for an intruder.
of course, surveillance cameras were installed all over the place.

name: tatsurou
normalized: this is fitting.
i began talking to shizuru-san.
my voice sounded like whispering, but if it weren't hidden by the wind, it would probably have reached all the way to the far end of the passageway.
the corridor had probably been constructed like that to make it easy to detect intruders.

name: shizuru
normalized: i suppose this is what it feels like to go into a machine's stomach.
shizuru-san answered, seeming to have the same impression as me.

name: tatsurou
normalized: it is, isn't it?

name: shizuru
normalized: well, i have a bad feeling.

name: tatsurou
normalized: me too…

name: shizuru
normalized: there's no telling what might appear.
anyway, let's move on to the end.
shizuru-san boldly smiled.

name: tatsurou
normalized: understood.
while paying close attention, we proceeded down the corridor towards the office we were aiming for.

name: tatsurou
normalized: （this place is…?!
suddenly, we exited into a large room.
it was an enormous size.
a large hall, about the height and width of the school gymnasium.
the fact that a place like this was here had not been recorded on the blueprints that shizuru-san had obtained, and

name: tatsurou
normalized: （i see.
that's what it is?
countless capsules about the size of telephone booths (which had become rare these days) were lined up on the floor of the hall.
murky green liquid filled those capsules.
the insides of them were bubbling as if something was breathing, and, although i didn't want to look too closely, what appeared to be some kind of living thing was squirming.

cords and pipes, which crisscrossed along the floor like capillaries, were connected to each capsule, and were linked to countless unidentifi- able devices that had been set up, with complexity that one could call nonsensical.
it slightly resembled kiryuu-san's laboratory, in the taimanin village.
but it didn't give any impression of refinement, for one thing, and it was far stranger.
the atmosphere this place created.
like the entrails of a chimera, which mixed several animals together to form one.
more than anything, the feeling of it was making my skin sting.
this was shouki.
(tl: a noxious aura given off by some paranormal beings.
that's right, a demonic presence.

name: shizuru
normalized: this is clearly hell's medical technology.
shizuru-san said, in a calm tone of voice.

name: tatsurou
normalized: it's certain that this place is not an upstanding facility.
i replied to that.
we had been shown a testing area like this all of a sudden, but that was as we expected.
washizu material co.
, and washizu shigeru, were not just a virtuous corporation and educator.
however, there were countless other large corporations that secretly obtained hellish medical technology and conducted private research.
naturally, that transgressed corporate ethics, but we couldn't say that there was proof that washizu material co.
had been involved in yazaki's underground business, just from evidence of this experimental facility.
we still needed to find the chips that had been implanted in yukikaze and rinko-nee.

name: shizuru
normalized: i suppose this is just an experimental area.

name: tatsurou
normalized: seems like it.

name: shizuru
normalized: as far as i can see, there don't seem to be any of those chips.

name: tatsurou
normalized: yeah.
it looks like there are still a few more floors underground, so shall we investigate them?
i knew the answer, but i asked shizuru-san just in case.

name: shizuru
normalized: no, washizu's office is the likely spot today.
we'll put off searching the whole place.

name: tatsurou
normalized: roger.
i nodded.
what they would have in a testing area like this were crossbred animals, genetically manipulated monsters, and, occasionally, people who had been sacrificed to them.
we may have felt anger, sorrow or righteous indignation, and it wasn't like it would be fun to see, either.
also, i had been taught that extreme emotions like that would occasionally get in the way of accomplishing missions.
right.
finding yukikaze and rinko-nee's chips was our first priority now.
i moved forward, trying not to look inside the capsules too much, when shizuru-san quickly came to a stop.

name: shizuru
normalized: hey, look.
when i turned around, shizuru-san was looking up at one of the large capsules.

name: shizuru
normalized: hora, look at this.

name: tatsurou
normalized: what is it?
since she said that, i had no choice but to look.
i focused my eyes on the contents of the capsule that shizuru-san pointed to.
as before, there was something squirming inside the stagnant fluid.
it was murky, so i couldn't tell very well, but it was large.
however, it was somewhat unnatural.
long, narrow arms on a round body―no, were those legs?
it had grown a number of them.
plenty of eyes on its head, which was small compared to its body.

name: tatsurou
normalized: the hell is this…?
an insect?
no, a spider?
it was oversized, so i couldn't tell immediately, but had they grown a spider to be this big?
no, that wasn't it.
this was――

name: tatsurou
normalized: this is… a mechanical spider…?!
mechanical parts that were clearly not from a living thing were mixed into its body, which was extremely big for a spider.
more than that, the surface of its body, which looked like a hard carapace, appeared to be entirely artificial.
based on a preconceived notion, we had been mistaken in thinking that it would be a living thing that had been put inside this type of capsule.

name: shizuru
normalized: looks like a weapon where they made a spider enormous and turned it into a cyborg.
it's the first time i've seen this type.

name: tatsurou
normalized: you've seen something that looked similar before, though?

name: shizuru
normalized: in the american federation.
things like this are their specialty.

name: tatsurou
normalized: really?
shizuru-san has been engaged in infiltration missions over there for a long time, huh?
shizuru-san nodded.

name: shizuru
normalized: in the national interest, the american federation is aggressively collecting hellish medical technology.

name: shizuru
normalized: for the sake of developing cyborgs, which combine organisms with machines; completely mechanical androids, which expand on that even further; and those sorts of things.

name: shizuru
normalized: i saw all sorts of things under development over there, but it's the first time i've seen this spider-type.
it's quite a well-made variety, isn't it?

name: tatsurou
normalized: be that as it may, this is a spider…?
i sighed, while looking at the squirming mechanical spider inside the capsule.

name: shizuru
normalized: to go out of their way to make a spider this big, and turn it into a cyborg… america is really macho, isn't it?
shizuru-san smiled like she was amazed.

name: tatsurou
normalized: what the hell would something like this… tch, it's obviously a weapon, isn't it?

name: shizuru
normalized: of course, it's an instrument of war.
in advanced nations, the price for a soldier's life is extremely high.

name: shizuru
normalized: it takes time and money to make an excellent soldier.
which means that it's a problem if that soldier dies easily.
pensions and state reparations for the bereaved families are not to be made light of.

name: tatsurou
normalized: that's why cyborgs, androids and things like that were introduced, huh?
so that they'll be all right even if they get injured, and ultimately won't die.

name: shizuru
normalized: something like that.
i can't tell whether it's brilliant or idiotic.
shizuru-san said cynically, and shrugged her shoulders.

name: shizuru
normalized: the androids are still in the experimental phase.
that's why the american federation is trying to develop cyborg weapons first, based on hellish medical technology.
at first, by remodelling animals.

name: shizuru
normalized: half-mechanical biological weapons that move at your will.
it was called the drone program.

name: tatsurou
normalized: drone program…
when i muttered that, i noticed that the surrounding atmosphere had changed.
danger was approaching.
shizuru-san also closed her mouth, and softly raised her right hand.
i didn't even have to confirm it.
it was a cue for caution.
we kept silent for a while, examining our surroundings.
there were no enemies.
well, none in the immediate vicinity.
i had a bad feeling.

name: shizuru
normalized: tatsurou-kun, can i say something?

name: tatsurou
normalized: by all means.

name: shizuru
normalized: i have a really bad feeling.

name: tatsurou
normalized: me too.

name: shizuru
normalized: it couldn't be because we were chatting?

name: tatsurou
normalized: who knows?
shizuru-san and i looked up at the capsule once more.
the fluid inside bubbled like it was boiling.
pishii!
minute cracks ran along the surface of the transparent capsule.
and then――
bariinnhh!

name: tatsurou
normalized: kuhh!

name: shizuru
normalized: i knew it, it got out!
the cyborg spider had smashed the capsule and jumped out.
pieces of the capsule flew around, and the fluid, which didn't seem like it would be too good for your body, suddenly streamed onto the floor.
of course, shizuru-san and i had made a big jump out of the way just before the capsule broke.
the cyborg spider landed on its eight legs so gently that it couldn't be imagined from its huge body.
and then, it rubbed its fangs, as if it were glad to have come out of the cramped capsule.
it was quite impressive.
when it was standing in front of my eyes, it felt even larger.
its head, which was small compared to its body, was swaying, and its numerous red eyes were examining us.

name: shizuru
normalized: to be honest, i'm not good with spiders…

name: tatsurou
normalized: it's not welcoming us, is it…?

name: shizuru
normalized: should we try greeting it or something?
i'll pass, though.

name: tatsurou
normalized: i'll――
pass too.
the instant i was about to say that,

name: cyborg spider
normalized: kishuu!
the cyborg spider opened its mouth, and thread was forcefully spewed out.

name: tatsurou
normalized: whoa?!

name: shizuru
normalized: i knew this would happen!
having been in the middle of talking, i panicked a little, but shizuru-san had the composure to dodge it.
i had been a little surprised because it was sudden, but the speed of the thread was not that great.
nonetheless, i didn't much want to picture what would happen if i were caught by it.
the cyborg spider's first thread attack had been evaded, and it stopped moving as if it were considering what to do.
were its movements still sluggish because it had just woken up, or was its battle program, which was under experimentation, not fine-tuned?
no matter which, it was fortunate.

name: shizuru
normalized: looks like this boy's the watchdog.

name: tatsurou
normalized: what do we do?!

name: shizuru
normalized: my tree escape arts are weak against mechanical opponents.
how about you?

name: tatsurou
normalized: it doesn't seem like armour that my wind blades would work on.
i complained honestly, and shizuru-san giggled.

name: shizuru
normalized: you didn't say 『please leave this place to me,』 or anything.

name: tatsurou
normalized: i'm not going to act tough like that.
i know two amazingly strong women, after all.

name: shizuru
normalized: we're agreed, then?

name: tatsurou
normalized: yes!
we immediately turned around.
it was our only means of escape.
